Interface JnrLibpcap

public interface JnrLibpcap
JNR-FFI bindings for the subset of libpcap APIs used by RADAR.

Methods map directly to the native pcap_* functions and are not thread-safe.

Since:
RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final JnrLibpcap
    INSTANCE
    Shared library instance used by RADAR capture adapters.

  • Field Details

    • INSTANCE

      static final JnrLibpcap INSTANCE
      Shared library instance used by RADAR capture adapters.
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Method Details

    • pcap_create

      jnr.ffi.Pointer pcap_create(String source, jnr.ffi.Pointer errbuf)
      Wraps pcap_create to allocate a capture handle for the given device.
      Parameters:
      source - network device (e.g., "eth0")
      errbuf - pointer to an error buffer
      Returns:
      pointer to an unactivated pcap_t handle or null on failure
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_set_snaplen

      int pcap_set_snaplen(jnr.ffi.Pointer p, int snaplen)
      Sets the snapshot length prior to activation.
      Parameters:
      p - handle returned by pcap_create(String, Pointer)
      snaplen - maximum bytes per packet to capture
      Returns:
      zero on success; negative on failure
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_set_promisc

      int pcap_set_promisc(jnr.ffi.Pointer p, int promisc)
      Toggles promiscuous mode.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      promisc - 1 to enable, 0 to disable
      Returns:
      zero on success; negative on failure
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_set_timeout

      int pcap_set_timeout(jnr.ffi.Pointer p, int to_ms)
      Sets the read timeout in milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      to_ms - timeout in milliseconds
      Returns:
      zero on success; negative on failure
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_set_buffer_size

      int pcap_set_buffer_size(jnr.ffi.Pointer p, int bytes)
      Sets the capture buffer size in bytes.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      bytes - requested buffer size in bytes
      Returns:
      zero on success; negative on failure
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_set_immediate_mode

      int pcap_set_immediate_mode(jnr.ffi.Pointer p, int on)
      Enables or disables immediate mode on the capture handle.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      on - 1 to enable immediate mode; 0 to disable
      Returns:
      zero on success; negative on failure
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_activate

      int pcap_activate(jnr.ffi.Pointer p)
      Activates the capture handle created via pcap_create(String, Pointer).
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      Returns:
      zero when activation succeeds; positive warning or negative error otherwise
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_compile

      int pcap_compile(jnr.ffi.Pointer p, BpfProgramStruct prog, String filter, int optimize, int netmask)
      Compiles a BPF filter expression.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      prog - program structure populated by libpcap
      filter - filter expression in tcpdump syntax
      optimize - non-zero to ask libpcap to optimize
      netmask - IPv4 netmask used for filter optimization
      Returns:
      zero on success; negative on failure
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_setfilter

      int pcap_setfilter(jnr.ffi.Pointer p, BpfProgramStruct prog)
      Applies a compiled BPF program to the capture handle.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      prog - compiled program produced by pcap_compile(Pointer, BpfProgramStruct, String, int, int)
      Returns:
      zero on success; negative on failure
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_freecode

      void pcap_freecode(BpfProgramStruct prog)
      Releases a compiled BPF program.
      Parameters:
      prog - compiled program to free
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_next_ex

      int pcap_next_ex(jnr.ffi.Pointer p, jnr.ffi.Pointer hdr_pp, jnr.ffi.Pointer data_pp)
      Reads the next available packet.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      hdr_pp - pointer-to-pointer receiving the packet header
      data_pp - pointer-to-pointer receiving the packet payload
      Returns:
      libpcap status code (1 packet, 0 timeout, -1 error, -2 EOF)
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_geterr

      String pcap_geterr(jnr.ffi.Pointer p)
      Retrieves the last error string for the handle.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle
      Returns:
      human-readable error message
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_close

      void pcap_close(jnr.ffi.Pointer p)
      Closes a capture handle.
      Parameters:
      p - capture handle to close
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • pcap_lib_version

      String pcap_lib_version()
      Returns the libpcap version string as reported by pcap_lib_version.
      Returns:
      libpcap version string as reported by pcap_lib_version
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
